loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata de 43 años comparte una vida conyugal con Alejandro de 41 años, sus hijos ya mayores son la muestra de que con trabajo la buena responsabilidad es posible a pesar tener recursos básicos se puede llegar a brindarles una educación de calidad. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Tiene la trascendencia familiar de dedicarse al campo de forma permanente manteniendo a lo largo de muchos años las técnicas y costumbres que fue heredando. Es así, que hace 20 años logró adquirir su propia parcela en donde viene dedicándose a la producción de café orgánico.
Se siente muy a gusto por seguir la costumbre familiar puesto que muestra un orgullo único de ser la futura heredera de las parcelas que su familia siempre trabajó. Al iniciarse una nueva campaña cafetera ha notado que es necesario realizar una limpieza de maleza a sus plantaciones puesto que es uno de los factores que influyen en la obtención de la calidad de granos. Por otro lado desea contar con sacos de abono orgánico para optimizar la producción.
Desea a futuro aperturar una tienda de abarrotes debido a que es consiente que las misma fuerza y energía que requieren las actividades en el campo no son eternas y es bueno abrirse de diversas maneras en el rubro comercial. Este es su préstamo número 14, muy orgullosa manifiesta que ha logrado superar muchos inconvenientes gracias a los préstamo otorgados. Es una socia muy participativa en su banco comunal puesto que esta atenta a los acuerdos que se toman y trata de mostrar siempre su punto de vista a manera de tomar acuerdos concretos.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado a la contrata de jornaleros para un adecuado deshierbo de maleza sobre sus plantaciones cafeteras y la adquisición de sacos con abono orgánico, muy esenciales para una producción eficiente.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 43, is married to Alejandro, 41. Their children, now grown, are the proof that with work and responsibility, it is possible to provide a quality education, even with basic resources. They live in a wooden house. She has the family tradition of working in the fields on a permanent basis, maintaining over many years the techniques and customs that were inherited. This is how, 20 years ago, she was able to acquire her own parcel of land where she works producing organic coffee. She is very pleased to carry out the family tradition, because she has the unique satisfaction in being the future inheritor of the land that her family always worked.

Upon starting a new coffee growing season, she has noticed that the plantings require weeding, since this is one of the factors that influences the quality of the coffee beans. She also wants sacks of organic manure to optimize production. In the future, she wants to open a grocery store, because she knows that the strength and energy that working in the field requires will not last forever. It is good to have various trade options.

This is her 14th loan. She proudly says that she has been able to overcome many obstacles thanks to the loans she has been given. She is very active in her communal bank, given that she pays attention to the agreements she makes and always tries to show her point of view when making specific agreements. With the 500 new soles, she will add to the money allocated to hire workers for an adequate weeding of her coffee plantings and to buy sacks of organic manure, which are very important to an efficient production.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the rubber plantation county in Liberia.  She is married and a high school graduate.  Since her husband’s nursing job in the local clinic provides little income, she is determined to make their lives better by engaging in a small provision shop.  Mamie has been in this business for twelve years now and enjoys the flow of her customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her shop (rice, oil, pepper, etc.).  Her dream is to become an international businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her shop (rice, oil, pepper, etc.).

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five children, one who is attending school.  She also takes care of grandchildren and elderly parents.  She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years.  In addition to this, she also generates additional income from renting rooms.  

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She works seven days a week from home and sells wholesale to all categories of people.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves due to her location in the slums.  She aspires to build more rental rooms and to buy a delivery van to aid transportation.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en: Iemaima is a 40 year old married woman with two children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.Iemaima has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, a wheel barrow and wires.  She became a member of SPBD in 2012.  Iemaima hopes to use her profits to pay her children's education fees.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, a wheel barrow and wires

loans.name: Lopeta

texts.en: Lopeta is a 62-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lopeta has requested a loan to improve her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Lopeta hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy timber, roofing, nails, cement, and tiles

loans.name: Umaro's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  This group of teachers has come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 7,800,000 Leones for the entire team.  Umaro, the featured leader, has requested a loan in order to pay school fees for his children.  Umaro is a 54-year-old native of the Mateboi village and has been a professional teacher for 30yrs.  He is married to a nurse and has 4 children, 3 in primary school and 1 in college.  

With this loan the group will be able to meet their immediate financial needs and will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.  The school’s bursar is directly responsible for deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay education fees for his children.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to have enough stock for her kiosk.

Mbodze is a determined woman who always looks for opportunities to progress in life. The previous loan had a great positive impact on her living standards. With this new investment, she will add stock of flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, 55, is a married woman with seven children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for several years now.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fuel for the boat and to pay for school fees. In the future, Margarita aims to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fuel for the boat and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: Ester est une femme de 41 ans célibataire mère de 3 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes, bananes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter le stock  des régimes de plantains, cajots de tomates, bananes) pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Ester is a 41 year old single woman and mother to 3 children. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh food (maniocs, plantains, palm nuts, bananas and fruits) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her clientèle which she gained with time thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock to be able to buy again because of her small capital. She wishes to increase her stock of bunches of plantains, boxes of tomatoes and bananas to have a good stock. This would allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (plantains, boxes of tomatoes, bananas).

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad del lavado de arena le fue bien con el anterior credito cuenta que compro el terreno se siente feliz, ahora solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas para realizar su trabajo de mejor manera ya que estan muy gastadas  y esto afecta ya que no le permite realizar un buen trabajo.
texts.en: Juan continues to work in the same field, sand blasting.  Things went well for him with the previous loan and he bought land so he’s happy.  Now he’s asking for a loan to buy tools to do his work in a more efficient manner. His current tools are worn out and this affects his ability to do good work.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 48 year old widow. She has been running a business of cloth trade for many years at her home. She started her business with just a few cotton cloths and over time she has become famous in her community for providing good quality cloths. She offers various types including linen, silk and cotton.

Being a single parent of nine children, she is responsible to provide them with the basic necessities of life. Three of her children are also working to contribute to the family income. In order to purchase more variety of cloths for the winter season, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). She expects a boost in her net income through her large sales. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the bright future of her children. Her children feel proud of their mother.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela  tiene 38 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 5, 7, 9 y 12 años, ella se dedica al tejido de chompas  desde hace ya varios años, su domicilio se encuentra  en el Zona Mariscal Santa cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Marcela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina bordadora  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para la compra de esta máquina que mucha falta le hacen,  la señora  Marcela desea con el tiempo abrir una tienda propia para exponer sus tejidos ya que ahora entrega en los distintos mercados de la Ciudad y de la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela, 38, is married and has four children, ages 5, 7, 9, and 12.  She has made a living knitting sweaters for several years.  Her house is located in the Mariscal Santa Cruz area.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  Marcela's going to use this loan to buy an embroidery machine.  She's requesting the loan because she doesn't have enough money to buy the machine.

In time Marcela wants to open her own store to show her textiles because now she sells in the various markets in the city and the area.  She's going to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 40-year-old Lebanese man.  He’s married, living with his family composed of his wife and two children attending school. He is looking to satisfy the family needs and respond to their demands with the cooperation of his wife, an adorable and supportive woman. 

Antoine started his own business in 1998. He works independently in the construction field and has more than a few projects to be accomplished. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required construction equipment that will allow him to carry on his work properly.  He is sure that in a short period of time he will be able to gain a fair number of clients and move out of the country, taking on bigger projects with higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase required construction equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali, a Lebanese married man. He’s 28 years old. Since his marriage, Ali has lived with his wife and two children. He was the one responsible for everything, especially covering their costs and expenses.  However, Ali doesn’t hesitate to offer his family whatever they ask for.  This is why he decided to start his own business. He opened his own mobile phone shop in 2010. He also sells recharge cards as extra earnings.

 In parallel, he serves in the internal security forces. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, and many other items. This Kiva loan will certainly increase his sales thus his profits. This is why Ali works every day to build a good future, hoping to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase added supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, and many other items

loans.name: Ngwele

texts.en:
Ngwele is married and blessed with one child, who is below the age of fifteen.  They live in a three-room apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of Northwest Cameroon.  She has faced some challenges in life including the death of her sister, the illness of her mother, and the inadequate capital to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Ngwele has a business making dresses.  With this loan she plans to buy more material for the smooth running of her business (traditional wear, threads, equipment), and the rest of the loan will be reserved to facilitate the function of the business.  She believes that her business will succeed because of her knowledge, the high demand for traditional dresses, the business location, and the regular customers who buy from her and resell in difference towns.  The community will also benefit because they will not have to go a long distance to buy their dresses.

With her profits, Ngwele will be able to improve the housing conditions of her family, pay school fees, and expand her business.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest rate, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy clothes, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and five children; one of them is working.  Mohammad’s family joins forces, trying to be supportive just to help him covering the heavy costs of life. Mohammad has eighteen years of experience in the agriculture field and started to work on his own tractor in 1997. He works on a free-lance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. 

Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his tractor and purchase new tires. He notes that this will develop his business and boost his returns.  In the future, he plans to buy a modern tractor and better develop his business.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his tractor and purchase new tires

loans.name: Maria Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 44 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 5, 7 y 10 años, ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista y también maquillaje y peinados en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de Viacha de la ciudad del Alto este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de algunos materiales que necesita y productos de belleza para brindar un amejor atencion a sus clientas y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  la Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Maria es tener su cadena de  salones de estética.
texts.en: Maria is 44 years old and has three children, ages 5, 7, and 10.  She is a manicurist and also does makeup and hairstyles in a beauty salon in Viacha, Alto.  This will be her first loan within the institution and she will use the money to buy some beauty products she needs to provide better service and increase her capital.  Maria has challenges in her business, such as over coverage of the market.  She will use her benefits to buy supplies and improve her work.  Maria wants to have a chain of salons.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Sra. Fabiana tiene 26 años, casada tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 1 y 3 años se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de mantas de lana de Alpaca para tiene su domicilio en la comunidad de Puerto Perez, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, Fabiana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus  mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en: Fabiana is 26 years old, married and has two children, ages 1 and 3.  She knits alpaca wool blankets and lives in Puerto Perez.  This will be her second loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy alpaca wool in quantity.  She makes many sales and has many orders in the different El Alto markets this time of year.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Ronald, de 56 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación, así como alegre y amable. Vive en compañía de su hijo de 15 años. Habitan en su propia casa cómodamente. La actividad que realiza Ronald es la transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con sus ahorros hace 03 años. Es así que cada mañana, se levanta muy temprano para buscar sus pasajeros por las calles de la ciudad realizando su jornada hasta el medio día, hora en que regresa a descansar, para luego volver a salir por unas horas en las tardes.
Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres.  Comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y por los ingresos económicos ya que tenía muchas necesidades y gastos que no podía solventar. Ahora se siente mas tranquilo y cómodo ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en los trámites de la compra de una furgoneta  de transporte de carga.
texts.en:
Ronald is 56 years old and is a hardworking man with many desires to succeed.  He’s also happy and friendly and lives with his15 year old son.  They live comfortably together in a home of their own. Ronald provides transportation with his moto-taxi, which he bought with his savings three years ago.  Each morning he gets early and goes out to search for passengers in town.  He stays out until noon and then takes a break and goes back out for a few hours in the evening.

He likes this because he can drive in his spare time.  He says that he decided to do this because he needed a trade and income because he had many financial needs and expenses.  Now he feels more relaxed and comfortable because he has a permanent income and more free time.  He is hoping for your cooperation so that he can solidify his plans.  He will use the money from this loan for 1,500 PEN to invest in a van.

loans.use: to buy a van.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
These hard working Tribal women call themselves by the group name “Ruth”. They all live in S. Laijang village in the state of Manipur which is in the North Eastern part of India. They formed the group in 2009, with an aim to generate income for themselves by accessing a loan.

Channu is one of the 10 members of the group and is pictured with raised hand. She is 30 years old and is a mother to three daughters. Two of her older daughters are studying at their intermediate grade in a private school nearby. Channu's husband is a hired auto-rickshaw driver, a kind of transportation ferrying passengers in and around the area. Channu’s previous activity before the loan was cultivating potatoes using the "jhuming" method of cultivation. Her activity could not be of much significance for supplementing the family income. Therefore she decided to open a general store for which reason she joined the group.

With her first loan in 2009, Channu opened a store of her own. She sells general items such as sugar, tea leaves, spices, salt, soap, toothbrushes, etc. With her second loan and with her profits she was able to expand her store by increasing her inventory. She is happy that she doesn’t have to wait for her husband’s return when the children need money for their school requirements such as pens, pencils, notebooks and so on. Now she manages the daily needs of the family with her income and save her husband daily earnings down to a rupee. 

The family plans to buy an auto-rickshaw of their own for better income in the near future. Channu, along with her husband, means to provide a good environment and create a sound family atmosphere for the children's education.  Now she needs another loan for her store business. She wishes to increase her stock in her general store. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members too need another loan for their respective income-generating activities. Potato cultivation, cabbage cultivation, cow rearing, piggery and poultry farming are some of the activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in her general store, such as rice, dal (lentils), sugar, milk powder, various kinds of soap, lightbulbs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Khupting Group

texts.en:
This is Khupting group consisting of nine members. These hard-working tribal women came together in 2010 to support one another to find ways and means to supplement the family income by accessing loan. They all live on the outskirts of Senapati district in Manipur state which is in the North Eastern part of India.

Mangneichong is one of the members, profiled here and pictured with raised hand. She is 22 years old and is a mother to a son and a daughter. She has yet to send her children to school. Her husband who is the main earner works as quarry worker and usually cuts wood to sell. Mangneichong's previous activity before accessing the loan was charcoal-making. 

With her first loan in 2009, Mangneichong started her own store selling general items. She really did well with her store business because it was the only store in her village. With the profit she was able to repay her loan and was also in the position to expand her store by increasing her inventory. With the second loan she expanded her store by bringing in more items, according to her customers' demand. With the profit she bought three piglets to rear. By the end of the year, from the sale of the grown pigs, she bought two He-Buffaloes to help her husband in his transportation of wood to sell. She is very happy that she is becoming a decision-maker for the family. 
 
Now Mangneichong needs another loan for her business. She wishes to increase her stock of general items. She also means to use part of the loan to purchase three more piglets to rear for profit. She plans to enroll her children in a private school next year. She is very happy that now she can support her children's education.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too are making steady improvement with their respective undertakings. Poultry farming, piggeries, a charcoal business, raising cows, and a ginger plantation are some of the income-generating activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store and buy three piglets to rear for profit with part of the loan

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.fr: Généviege est une femme de 42 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 03 et 23 ans . Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des sacs de macabo pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Génévieve is a 42 year old woman, married and mother to 6 children whose ages range from 3 to 23 years old. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh foods (macabos, maniocs, plantains, palm nuts and fruits) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her clientèle which she gained with time thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock to be able to buy again. This is because of her small capital. She would like to buy bunches of plantains and bags of macabo to have a good stock. This will allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets of macabo and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 26-year-old lady, who lives in Margibi County with her two children. The children are 3 and 10 years old, and they are in school. Getrude is a high school graduate, and has been involved with business for the past ten years. She was helped by her mother and, as of today’s date, she has started operating a small, mini provision shop. The shop is her source of income for her living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like rice, oil, candy and biscuits, to resell in her shop.

She hopes to build a new home for her children, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like rice, oil, candy and biscuits, to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel earns a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store. She has been in the business for more than three years.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to offer for sale in her store, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soda. She hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her convenience store, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soda.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children, two of them below the age of 15. The family lives in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division, North West region of Cameroon. She has encountered many challenges in life, including the death of her brother which forced her to stop school at a tender age, illness of her children, too little money to provide square meals to her children and to provide education for her children.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase foodstuffs, like beans, rice, oil, Irish potatoes and yellow yams, and she will pay for the transportation of these foodstuffs from the bush market to her place of business. She believes that her business will succeed, because of her longevity in the business, the high demand for foods such as beans and yams in the community, her good business location, and the regular customers who buy foods from her for resale and for restaurant use. The community will benefit, because they will not have to go a long distance to buy foodstuffs.

The profits will help her to improve the housing conditions of her family, to provide better education for the children, and to expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE, because of the convenient repayment period, the low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy foods like beans, rice, oil, Irish potatoes and yellow yams, and to transport these things from the bush market to her place of business.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David tiene 29 años sigue con la misma actividad de la tienda de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad  , cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes por mayor, panetones, vino y Cidra para esta época de fin de año.
texts.en: David is 29 years old and has a neighborhood store where he sells primary needs products.  He says that things went well with the previous loan and this time he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as groceries in quantity, breads, wine, and cider for the year end season.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 52 años,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de palomitas de maíz o también conocidas como pipocas que se encuentran en diferentes zonas, ya que las embolsa en distintos tamaños y reparte a colegios, universidades, regimientos militares y tiendas de barrio, este préstamo es el segundo que ha tomado con la institución, Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como maíz por quintales para la elaboración de palomitas de maíz, también hará maní confitado y comprar mani  por mayor, Maria va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando quintales de maíz y también comprara 2 quintales de maní y 2 quintales de azúcar para incursionar en la venta de maní confitado su deseo es el poder  comprar un terreno para sus hijos ya que por ahora vive en la casa de su mama.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old and makes and sells popcorn, also known as pipocas in some zones.  She bags it up in different size bags and passes them out to schools, universities, military regiments, and neighborhood stores.  This will be her second loan through the institution and Maria will use the money to buy supplies like corn by the bushel to make popcorn and also make candied peanuts in quantity.  Maria will also use the benefits to continue buying bushels of corn and two of peanuts and sugar to venture into selling candied peanuts.  She wants to buy land for her children.  They currently live wither mother.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Munawer

texts.en:
Ms Munawer is 55 years old. She has been in the business of milk sales for 11 years. She started her own business to support her family by buying a buffalo when her husband was the only bread winner. With the passage of time her sales and income have both increased. Now she has five buffaloes and cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

She is a mother of five. Three of them go to school. Because of her work she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This wilk help her to be able to cater to more customers in her vicinity which will ultimately improve her earnings. She expects a boost in her business income and she hopes to expand her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 26 years old. She owns a boutique selling foodstuffs. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar, and shoes for sale. The profits from the business will used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en: Megi is from Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 47 years old and lives with her 27-year-old son. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, Megi has a pig and sells piglets seasonally. Megi works hard to do her best for her family. Megi wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Megi and her son suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Foday B's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Affia, a village near Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 4,300,000 Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be empowered to meet their immediate financial challenges. And, at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Salifu is the leader of this group. The 41 year old is a native of Affia village. He is married and has four children attending school. Salifu has served in the teaching profession for 12 years now. However, he is pursuing further studies.  He has therefore requested for this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is a 49-year-old widow with four children who lives in Margibi County. Her children are between the ages of 22 and 30 and are living on their own. Watta has been running a table market for 16 years and she hopes to make it into a shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice palm oil, pepper, and other items for the business. She hopes for her living condition to improve in the near future and to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice palm oil, pepper, and other items for her business,

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn, 37 years old, lives in Aragyux village of Kotayk region with his parents and two children. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. At school, he was one of the best pupils and had a dream of studying at university. But, unfortunately, his parents didn't have enough income to pay for his education. Now, Vahagn works at a local company doing legal work. Last year, he entered Yerevan State University, where he specializes in the judicial field. 
Raising two little kids alone is very difficult for Vahagn, so he has applied for the loan. With the loan's help, Vahagn will pay his university tuition. 
Vahagn wishes to complete his education, start his own business and ensure a better future for his beloved kids.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Namen

texts.en:
Namen is a single mother with four children, three younger than 15. The family lives in a four-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. 
She has faced some challenges in life such as sickness, the death of a family member and inadequate capital to improve her business, which is the greatest problems she is currently facing.
With this loan, she plans to improve her farming and improve the present situation of her business. She plans to buy grand nuts, cocoyams, plantains and bananas. She will also buy beans, garri and seedlings for her farm.  Most of the items will be bought in bulk to allow her to benefit from discounts. She believes her business will succeed because of her longevity and the high demand for her commodities in her community. The community will benefit in that people will not have to travel long distances to buy food items. 
The profit will help her improve the situation of her family, providing better education and meeting health care needs, and also help her to expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, garri, dry corn, ground nuts, plantains and other commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une femme de 44 ans mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, patates, macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des cajots de tomate pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Marguerite is 44 years old and the mother of a family. She is a merchant and has sold various food items (tomatoes, potatoes, cocoyams, manioc, plantains, palm nuts, and fruit) at retail on a seasonal basis at a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of the suppliers and especially her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in this business. However, she constantly faces stock shortages because she needs to sell her entire stock in order to buy new supplies, due to the small amount of capital she has. With this loan, she hopes to buy bunches of plantains and bags of tomatoes to build a larger stock, which will allow her to better satisfy her customers' constant needs and avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plantains and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maqsoodah

texts.en:
Ms Maqsoodah is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children, all of whom go to school.

She has been selling used clothes for eight years. Her husband also assists her in selling the clothes to customers and the local market. She earns enough from this business to lead a decent life. 

Ms Maqsoodah has been involved with Kashf for three years and has gradually improved her business with its support. She has applied for a 15,000 Pakistanti rupee loan in order to purchase winter clothes such as sweaters, pants and coats to sell. 

With this loan she will be able to cater to her customers' needs better, which will ultimately help in generating more income. 

She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes such as sweaters, pants and coats for resale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda earns a living through selling cassava chips which she buys from a farm. Cassava is valued in the Philippines for culinary purposes and is also used to make flour.

Merlinda has been in this business for more than six years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more cassava chips. 

In the future, Merlinda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more cassava chips to sell.

loans.name: Tugwizumwimbu Group

texts.fr:
Aline  fait partie du groupe  Turwizumwimbu et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 25 ans et est marié à  J. Marie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants dont 3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de viande de vache  depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  quelques vaches de plus; toutes ces vaches seront abattues pour vendre  une grande quantité de viande,  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    acheter  une grande propriété foncière afin d’entreprendre un vaste projet agro-pastoral.
texts.en:
Aline is a part of the Turwizumwimbu group and lives in Gitega. She is 25 years old and married to a man named J. Marie, a merchant. Together, they have four children, of whom three go to school. 

Aline has been selling beef for six years. She is on her 11th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy some more cows. These cows will be slaughtered and their meat will be sold, allowing her to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a large piece of land in order to commence a large agro-pastoral project.

loans.use: to buy some cows

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru: Арзыкан 48 лет, разведена. Образование высшее.К жизни относиться оптимистично, верит в себя и в светлое будущее своей семьи. Арзыкан очень добрая, общительная, умная и шустрая. Арзыкан  начала свой бизнес 12 лет назад начальная сумма вклада составляла 100,000 KGS. Сегодня Товарооборот Арзыкан  составляет 150,000 KGS. На местном рынке Арзыкан  занимается реализацией одежды и шторы.  В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота за счет покупки зимнего ассортимента утепленных вещей. На доход полученный от кредита она планирует расширять бизнес, и будущем мечтает бостроить двух этажный магазин.
texts.en:
Arzykan is 48 years old, divorced, and she has a higher education degree.  She also has an optimistic outlook on life: she believes in herself and in a bright future for her family.  Moreover, she is very kind, sociable, intelligent and sharp.  

Arzykan started her own business 12 years ago with an initial investment of 100,000 som (KGS).  Her working capital now consists of 150,000 som (KGS).  

Arzykan sells clothes and curtains at the local market.  In order to further expand her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to increase her inventory and buy an assortment of warm winter goods. 

She plans to use the earnings from this loan to expand her business.  In the future, she is dreaming of opening a two-story shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy an assortment of warm winter goods.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is from the village of Tsutskhvati. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife and retired farther. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with a calf and three milk cows. The milk is used in cheese products. He sells the dairy from his house. Grigol also owns four sheep and a pig. In addition, the family grows nuts on the family-owned land. They do all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested nuts are sold at the local open market. He works hard to earn some savings and improve the living conditions for his family. 

Grigol requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 47-years-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, business for several years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Milagros is asking for a loan to buy more inventory to sell in her store like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With a loan, she will be able to improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her store like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from Tkibuli district. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife, retired farther and 7-year-old daughter who goes to the local school. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with one milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. He sells the dairy products at the local open market. 

In addition, the family grows maize on the family-owned land. They do all the relevant agricultural works to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested maize is sold locally. He works hard to earn some savings and improve the living conditions for his family. 

George requested a loan for purchasing an additional milking cow. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Fanalie

texts.en:
This is Fanalie, 44, a resident of Silang, Philippines. She is married to Roy, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Fanalie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fanalie hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Uriat

texts.ru: Урият 53 года, вдова, мать 4 сын. По характеру человек очень хороший и спокойный.  Урият в качестве основного дохода с 1980 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Урият в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Также, Урият обрабатывает 1,2 га земли с эспарцетом и ячменем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урият обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Урият планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и на следующий год отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Uriat is a 53-year-old widow and mother of four sons. She is a good, quiet person. 

As her family's main income provider, Uriate has been working in animal husbandry since 1980. She started her business with 3,000 som. Thanks to persistent work, today she has two dairy cows and ten sheep on her farm. Additionally, Uriat cultivates 1.2 hectares of land with sainfoin and barley. 

With long-term business development in mind, Uriat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som to purchase lambs to feed and later resell. She plans to use the income from the loan to eventually increase the number of livestock on her farm and to renovate her home next year.

loans.use: To purcahse some lambs

loans.name: Enver

texts.ru:
Энвер житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 62 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его сын и дочь работают в собственном продуктовом магазине. Жена Энвера домохозяйка. 
Энвер намерен заняться животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа двух бычков и корма для крупнорогатого скота, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Enver lives in the J. Rumy region. He is a 62-year-old married man with two children. His son and daughter work in their own grocery store. His wife is a homemaker. 

Enver intends to start working in animal husbandry. He is requesting this loan to purchase two steer and cattle feed in order to start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase two steer and feed for cattle

loans.name: Natela

texts.ru: Натэла жительница города Душанбе. Она 28 - летняя девушка. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Натэла имеет высшее образование, она экономист. По профессии она не работала. Натэла пять лет проработала в салоне красоты, парикмахером. После того как вышла замуж она занялась воспитанием детей. На сегодняшний день Натэла хочет начать свое дело. Она берет кредит для приобретения мебели и оборудования, чтобы открыть собственный салон красоты.
texts.en:
Natela lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is a 28-year-old married woman and mother of two. 

She has a college education in economics, but she has not worked in this field. She worked as a hairdresser for five years in a beauty salon. Then, after she got married, she stayed at home to raise her children. Now Natela would like to start her own business. She is requesting this loan to purchase furniture and equipment to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and equipment to open her own beauty salon

loans.name: Khayriddin

texts.ru: Хайриддин житель района Восеъ. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Хайриддина домохозяйка. Его дети маленькие. Он работает на рынке. У Хайриидина имеется торговая точка, где он продает женскую одежду. Также он продает женскую обувь. Торговлей Хайриддин занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки тканей и детской одежды.
texts.en:
Khayriddin is a 32-year-old resident of the Vose region. He is married and has three small children. His wife is a homemaker. 

Khayriddin works at the market. He has his own stall, where he sells women's clothing and women's shoes. He has been working in sales for five years. He is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and children's clothing

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 38 year old married woman and mother four young children from Ubay, Bohol.  She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years.  That is the source of their income. 
Elena is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.  Through this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Elena hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading and frozen food businesses. Elsa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Kenjekkul

texts.ru: Кенжекул 31 года, замужем, у них с мужем 3 детей. Кенжекул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с замужества. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжекул и ее семьи, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец, 2 головы лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Кенжекул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и построить большие сараи для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Kenjekkul is a 31-year-old married mother of three. As the main income provider for her family, she has been working in animal husbandry for eight years. She started her business when she got married. Thanks to persistent work, Kenjekkul and her family now have four cows, 20 sheep, and two horses on their farm. 

With long-term business development in mind, Kenjekkul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som loan to purchase more cattle. She will use the income from this loan to invest in long-term business development and to build large barns where they can keep their cattle.

loans.use: To purchase calfs

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arcenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Arcenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Arcenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yarpu

texts.en: Yarpu is 49 years old and lives in Margibi County, a noted rubber producing area in Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 13 to 16; all of them attend school. For the past two years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells soft drinks. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a bakery business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kosar’s husband. They offer various items such as biscuits, cakes, rusks and bread. They have become famous in their community for providing good quality baked goods. 

Kosar is a mother of five children; two of them are going to school. She is working hard to provide them with the all necessities of life which they deserve. In order to purchase oil, sugar, flour and baking powder from the market at lower rates, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25000 PKR. With this loan, they will be better able to meet customers’ demand time after time. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the prosperous and bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, flour and baking powder from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Sasagara Ii Group

texts.fr:
Rosette  fait partie du groupe  Sasagara II  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 69 ans et est mariée à  Elie, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de  restaurant depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de produits vivriers (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) à vendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    acheter  une parcelle et des champs cultivables.
texts.en:
Rosette is a member of the "Sasagara II" group and lives in Gitega. She is 69 years old and married to Elie, a farmer. The couple have 2 children together.

Rosette has run a restaurant for 10 years. This is her 10th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of food (beans, rice, palm oil, etc.) to cook and sell in her restaurant, so that she can earn more money. In the years ahead, she would like to buy a plot of land and some cultivable fields.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of food (beans, rice, palm oil, etc.) to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Rama Ii Group

texts.fr:
Suavis fait partie du groupe  Rama II et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 24 ans et est mariée à  Rémy, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  2  jeunes enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de savons, des piles, de lait de beauté,  des cahiers, depuis  4ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  savons, de piles, de lait de beauté, de cahiers, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une  très belle maison.
texts.en:
Suavis is a member of the group "Rama II" and lives in Gitega. She is 24 years old and married to Rémy, a merchant. The couple have 2 children together.

Suavis has been selling soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for 4 years. This is her 4th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the years ahead, she would like to build a beautiful house.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for resale.

loans.name: Argina

texts.en:
Argina lives in Kapan with her husband and two sons. Her elder sun Vache studies history at Goris State University. Vache is in his 2nd year of study. 

Argina works as a nurse at local clinic, and her husband works at a bakery. Their monthly income covers only the family's basic costs and doesn't allow them to pay for their son's education. Therefore, Argina has requested this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan will help Argina's son to complete his education and become a specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor has been earning a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business for several years now. She sells various items to people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. Miraflor needs a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, seasoning and cooking ingredients. In the future, Miraflor wants to make her business a success and save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, seasoning and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is from the village of Rokhi. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband, retired mother and two sons. Lena’s husband works as an artisan locally and gets a small monthly income. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. She sells the dairy products from her house. Additionally, Lena owns a pig and sells piglets seasonally. She works hard to make some savings and improve her family's living conditions. Lena requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese, allowing her to expand her business and earn a good profit. With these increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, spend more on the family’s daily needs, and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari, 53, is married and has 5 children. He lives in a community in the town of Tiribe, in the coastal region of Kenya.

Bakari decided to start up his own business selling charcoal three years ago.

At this time, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES. He plans to use these funds to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

Bakari hopes that his business will grow with this financial support. Also, he will be able to have better customer service, as he will have enough stock available to meet the demand.

Bakari's goal is to have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en: Yatta is 31 years old and lives in Margibi County. She is married and stopped her education at only grade two. She has two children, ages 13 and 14, that are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Gurpu

texts.en:
Gurpu, 48, resides with  her husband in the Congo Town community. She is a hardworking mother of five children who are between the ages of 22 and 33. All of her children live outside the home and are independent. For the past four years, she has been selling coal in her community. She sells for eleven hours a day and makes a profit when she sells. She uses some of the profits to buy more goods to improve her business. Gurpu started this business with a little capital that she had been saving with a saving club.She transports her goods by a commercial vehicle to her business area. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. Her dream is to become a business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Ms. Zaib is a 42-year-old married woman. Two year ago, her husband died a natural death. After her husband's death, she was worried about her family, as her husband was the single breadearner, but she didn't lose hope and started a small general store in the corner of her house to support her children. By this time, she has become famous in her community.

Ms. Zaib offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She wants to grow her business and has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to buy packs of biscuits, beverages, and a stock of sugar from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, beverages, and a stock of sugar from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: 25-year-old Gevorg lives in Yerevan with his mother. He is a very intelligent and proactive young man. He is proudly pursuing his university degree at Armenian State Economical University, where he specializes in the field of statistics. Together with his studies, Gevorg also works at the Ministry of Emergency Situations. Because he helps his mother with household costs, it is difficult to save money for his education. With this loan, he will pay for  his university tuition. This will enable him to complete his education and ensure a better future for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri radica en la comunidad de san Agustín, es una persona cuyo liderazgo le han valido para sobresalir entre su familia de forma acelerada. Tiene dos hijos Roy de 14 años y Miky de 11, pero no viven con él. Es poseedor de una vivienda construida a base de madera. Al cumplir un buen tiempo como agricultor de cacao orgánico decidió optar por un camino más comercial y dinámico desempeñándose como acopiador de productos agrícolas en su comunidad.
Lleva desempeñando su trabajo desde hace 3 años, tiempo que ha logrado hacerse muy conocido por los productores de su zona a quienes adquiere diversos productos como cacao, café, achiote, palillo y barbasco para almacenarlos en un almacén habilitado en su domicilio.
Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que es menos forzoso mas no algo sencillo, puesto que debe contactar con acopiadores mayores de la ciudad para obtener precios justos  para los productos que comercializa beneficiando así tanbien a los productores de su localidad. Desea contar con capital de respaldo para llevar adelante su actividad logrando así recuperar su inversión en corto plazo y con ganancias adicionales.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan la compra de un terreno en la ciudad puesto que sus hijos están a puertas de culminar sus estudios secundarios y como buen padre desea brindarles una educación superior justa , que mejor que lo hagan a futuro en una casa propia para el cual se encuentra trabajando muy duro. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles proseguirá con las actividades de su negocio con la compra de los productos agrícolas de su localidad para luego vendérselo a los acopiadores mayores de las grandes ciudades.
texts.en:
Yuri lives in the community of San Agustín and is a person whose leadership makes him really stand out from his family.  He has two children, Roy (14 years old) and Miky (11) but they do not live with him.  Yuri owns a home built out of wood.  After working some time growing organic cocoa, he decided to head down a more dynamic and commercial path and became a middle man, selling agricultural products from his community.

He has now been doing this for three years and has made himself well-known to the producers in the area.  He now buys various products from these local producers, such as cocoa, coffee, annatto, turmeric and barbasco, which he stores in a space in his home.

He says that he really enjoys his work because he does not feel forced into and it is modest work.  He must contact the bigger wholesalers from the city so that he can sell the products for a fair price, so that the products he is selling are profitable for the producers.  He would like some financial backing so that he can move his business forward, earn back his investment in the short-term, and make a profit.

In the long-term, his aim is to buy land in the city because his children will soon finish high school and, like any good father, he would like to support them with a good further education and their own home.  Yuri is working very hard for this.

With 3000 Nuevo Soles, he will persist with his business by buying agricultural products in his own town, so that he can sell them to bigger wholesalers in the big cities.

loans.use: to buy bags of cocoa, coffee, annatto, turmeric and barbasco to sell to wholesalers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of eight children.

Nida has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now with her husband.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Nida aims to expand her business to augment their income. Additionally, she wants to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a food vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells home-cooked food to the people in her place. She has been in the business for several years now. Pacita is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and rice. With this, she will be able to cook more to sell. In the future, Pacita wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Unite Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Nyota est une femme dynamique du groupe unité. Elle est mere d’une famille de 9 enfants tous scolarisés à l’âge de 46ans. Elle est vendeuse des boisons sucrées depuis la mort de son mari (5ans) au  marché central de la ville. Le credit  sollicité sera affecté dans le même commerce  en s’approvisionnant en  11 caisses de boissons sucrées.  Son rêve est que ses activités croissent jusqu'à avoir un dépôt(vente en gros). Elle remercie Hekima pour ces prêts.
texts.en: Nyota, the customer, is a dynamic woman and a member of the group "Unité". She is 46 years old and the mother of 9 children who all attend school. She has been selling soft drinks at the town's central market since her husband died, 5 years ago. The loan being requested will be spent on this business and used to buy 11 cases of soft drinks. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can eventually buy a warehouse and sell wholesale. She thanks Hekima for these loans.

loans.use: to buy 11 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who is determined to change his future and that of his children through hard work. He operates a retail shop and is also a farmer, mainly growing cocoa due to its high demand in the region and low cost of production. Like most responsible fathers, he desires to educate his children up to university. He also wants to venture into sustainable income generating activities with the aim of securing a future for his family. Joseph intends to use this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married with six children. All are older than fifteen years old. Comfort lives with her six children in a ten-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. Comfort encountered some challenges in her lifetime: sickness, the death of her daughter, the death of her grandchild, and the death of her parents. 

With the loan, Comfort plans to buy  two bags of corn,  one bag of garri, buckets of kumkum (dried, graded cassava), a bag of onions,  two cartons of fish, tomatoes, magi, and salt for retail. She believes this activity will succeed because of her longevity in this activity and also she has so many customers. Her business site is located in a strategic place where many people pass by.  The high demand for her commodities in the community is a reason for the success of the activity. The community will benefit in that many people prefer to buy directly from the farm at cheaper prices. 

With the profit, she plans to provide better education, health care for the family and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn,  one bag of garri, buckets of kumkum (dried graded cassava), a bag of onions, cartons of fish, tomatoes, magi, and salt.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.en:
Honorine is married with two children below the age of 15. The family lives in a five-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region, Cameroon. 

Honorine has faced some difficulties in life. A member of her family died after spending some time in the hospital and one of her children has been ill. She has had problems with feeding her children well and catering for their education. She has also had problems finding adequate capital to start up a business.

With the loan she has requested, Honorine will expand her business by buying more items to sell such as soap, laundry products, stocks and sauces and fruit drinks. 

Part of the loan will be used for transporting products from the market to her business site. 

Honorine believes her business will succeed because of her years of experience and the high demand for her products. She has a good business site and has regular customers who buy from her. 

Her community will benefit because they will not need to travel long distances to buy fruit drinks.

With the profits from her loan, Honorine will expand her business, help improve her family's housing conditions, and provide for her family's health and education. She prefers to use a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education provided at their meetings.

loans.use: to buy and transport general grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Jowani

texts.en: Jowani used his previous loan to buy drugs to sell. He is a 29-year-old married man with a child living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a drug shop which he has operated for 3 years, and business is booming since he enjoys a monopoly in his market. Among his hardships are customers who don't pay on time and high fuel and transportation costs. Educating his child and building a permanent residential home for his family are his personal goals, while he dreams of expanding his business into new markets and owning a pharmacy. Jowani intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a tailor and has been in service ever since he left vocational school ten years ago. His skills in tailoring can not go unnoticed due to his emphasis on details while making clothes. Thus, he has a large customer base, mainly schools and hotels who order for uniforms in large quantities. However, inadequate capital to buy modern sewing machines hinders his business.

His dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees at university. Moses intends to use this loan to buy materials for making uniforms.

loans.use: to buy materials for making uniforms.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 57-year-old married man with one child living in Masindi, Uganda. Fifteen years ago, he decided to start a retail shop, and his business has grown over time so that he now boasts of a supermarket. Like most traders, he is faced with the challenge of price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is to open branches in other towns.

Good father that he is, he has so far educated his child, who has now graduated with a degree. He also has other dependents whose fees he pays. Most of them are orphans. Tom is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as bread, tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bread, tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu, 49, lives in the Congo Town community with her husband. She is a mother of five children, aged between 22 and 38. Four of the children live with her at home but are not in school because she lacks financial support. Fatu stopped her own education in the 4th grade. She has had a table in the market where she has been selling peppers, onions, vita, salt, palm oil, rice and cooking oil for the past seven years. She sells from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She is proud of her business because she makes profit, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business and attend the expenses of the home. She has requested this loan to purchase more peppers,onions, vita, rice, and palm oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, onions, vita, rice, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula is taking out another loan to start a new business. She wants to open a grocery store in her home. Thanks to her efforts and the previous loan, she was helped to have a good harvest. Nyamvula intends to use this loan to buy stock of flour, cooking oil, rice, beans and medicines. At the same time, she intends to purchase more planting materials for her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, cooking oil, rice, beans, medicines and planting materials.

loans.name: Mado

texts.en: Mado, 30, has six children between the ages of 2 and 6. All but the two youngest of Mado’s children attend school. She sells potatoes, bananas and many other items. She has been doing this business for three years. She plans to use the profits that she will obtain from the business to buy a plot of land. Mado is celebrating Christmas with her children for the festive season.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Zozan

texts.en:
Zozan, who is 58 years old, lives in Arevadasht village with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. With 300 lambs and 21 cows, the entire family is involved in cattle breeding. Zozan uses the milk in cheese production and provides beef to local butchers. Both milk and beef are very popular among the buyers, thereby making the business profitable. But as the family is big, there are many costs to cover.

Zozan would like to expand her enterprise and increase the number of livestock through the purchase of five heifers and forage for feeding them. This will significantly increase her family's income and enable Zozan to secure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for five heifers and forage to feed them.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old. She is married with three children between 5 and 16. All her children attend schools. Her husband is also a businessman. 

Francine sells shoes. She has been doing this business for 15 years. With the loan, Francine will add more shoes for sale to make more profits. She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for buying a house. She looks forward to celebrating the Christmas season with her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, soap, salt and cups to sell. She is a 28-year-old woman with four children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After selling off her cocoa, she started a retail business with the profits she earned. 

She is challenged by price fluctuations and customers not paying on time. Her dreams are educating her children to the university level and moving her business to a more permanent location.

Ester intends to use the loan to buy maize flour, cassava and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassava and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
