Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: jeannette est une femme de 47 ans mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend les poissons fumés, les fruits et les bananes en fonction des saisons dans une marché de la capitale depuis 03 ans . Son activité fonctionne bien elle conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. elle s’accroît au jour le jour tous ceci à cause de la bonne qualité de ses produits et aussi des prix pratiqués. Elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui non seulement d'augmenter son stock poissons fumés, mais aussi d'augmenter ses ventes surtout avec l'approche des fêtes. son bénéfice aussi augmentera. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces revenus dans son activité le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que sa famille.
texts.en: Jeannette is a young 47 year old woman and a mother. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling smoked fish, fruit and bananas according to the seasons at a market in the capital for 3 years. Her business functions well. She has gained an appreciative and loyal clientèle with time. Her clientèle grows day to day due to the good quality of her products and also the prices offered. She doesn't manage to satisfy her clientèle anymore thus the importance of this loan which will not only increase her stock in smoked fish, but also increase her sales especially with the approaching holidays. Her profits will also increase. She will reinvest part of her income in her business and the rest will allow her to meet her needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of smoked fish, bananas and fruits.

loans.name: Santos Justiniano

texts.es:
Santos con 53 años de edad, originario de Managua, soltero, padre de 3 hijos ya son independientes, con conocimiento académico de primaria, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de queso. Santos  inicio su negocio por medio de su jefe  quien también se dedicaba a la misma actividad, el le ayudaba a vender  queso, con el tiempo fue obteniendo experiencia y total dominio en el negocio, luego decide independizarse, pone su puesto de venta de queso en el mercado, el cuenta con el apoyo de su hija que le ayuda con la administración del negocio, su expectativa es crecer en productos y  comprar mas queso  para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
El solicita el préstamo para comprar  más queso, cuajadas y crema etc. Ya que el estima que le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas y así obtener mas ganancias, sus planes futuro es aumentar sus producción de queso, ya que sus metas próxima  es vender en mayor cantidad sus productos lácteos y de  manera rápida  para invertir siempre en el negocio. Su principal sueño  es comprar otro local para expandir su negocio y de esta manera poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 53, is a Managua native. He is single and a father of 3 children that have moved out. With his knowledge from school and work, he makes a living selling cheese. 

Santos began his business with his boss, who also works with cheese, helping him with sales. Over time, Santos has been gaining experience and mastery of the business. Later on, he decided to start his own business. 

With the administrative help of his daughter, he sells his cheese in the market. His expectation is to increase the number of products and buy more cheese to satisfy the needs of his customers. 

He is requesting this loan to buy more cheese, curd, cream, and other things, since he believes that this will help him increase sales, thereby earning more money. He plans to increase production of his cheese, since his next goals are to sell his dairy products in larger quantities and invest in his business. 

His dream is to buy another property so he can expand his business. This way he can move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy more cheese, curd, cream, and other things.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito's main source of income comes from his rice production business. He is 53 years old, married and has four kids. He is from Taguitic, Kapatagan and has been farming there for three years, earning PHP 12,200 a month. 

This year, Warlito joined GDMPC. Warlito is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Allahrakkhi

texts.en:
Ms Allahrakhi, a 38-year-old married mother of two daughters and a son, is striving hard to meet their food, clothing, and health needs. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Allahrakh started her business to contribute to the family income.

Allahrakh has been making jewelry for many years, having initiated her business with the support of a Kashf Foundation loan she took to buy a jewelry machine. Well familiar with jewelry-making techniques, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

Allahrakh has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy raw materials such as artificial gems, pearls, silver and gold to complete her customers’ orders on time. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as artificial gems, pearls, silver and gold to complete customers’ orders on time.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Leonila works hard to support her family. She sells rice in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from making furniture. Leonila is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities with her four previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds for her ducks. Lolita has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her ducks

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en: Peleiupu is a 41-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Peleiupu has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, crops, knives, and other equipment needed for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Peleiupu hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, crops, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Lukande Lemi

texts.en: Lukande is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. With his previous loan, he increased his capital and paid part of his children's school fees. He is now requesting a loan to buy soda, soap, juice, air time, and many other items for his shop. Lukande says that he is happy for Finance Sudan's loans through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like soda, soap, and juice for his store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 20 years old and married, with one child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and she has been doing this for many years. 

Rosana has requested a loan to buy a canoe, spear, goggles, and fishing nets. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rosana will use her next loan to improve her plantation business, just to back up her current business.

loans.use: to support her fish-selling business by buying a canoe, spear, goggles, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto tiene 27 años, se dedica  a la venta de materiales de construcción él tiene su depósito de materiales de construcción en la zona de Pampa de la Isla,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Roberto va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción por mayor para llenar su depósito y algunas herramientas que le permitan realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Roberto va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su familia, el Sr. Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto is 27 years old. He sells construction materials and has a  warehouse in the Pampa de la Isla area. This is his first loan with Emprender. Roberto will use the loan to purchase construction material wholesale and fill his warehouse. He will also buy some tools, which will enable him to do his job efficiently. The reason he is requesting a loan is to continue improving his business.

Sr. Roberto will use his profits to purchase electrical appliances for his family. He is a very hardworking person and is happy to have been granted a loan since his business is the only source of income he has to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Hilda Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda sigue con la actividad de la venta de desayunos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de desayunos como café, te y azúcar por mayor.
texts.en: Sra. Hilda continues with her business selling breakfasts. She notes that her previous loan went very well. She expanded her business and increased her customer base as well as her income. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients to make her breakfasts wholesale, such as coffee, tea and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase tea, coffee and sugar to make her breakfasts.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, a 29-year-old married mother of two, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years now. Having received five previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business, Maricel has requested a new one for PHP 13000 to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pula

texts.en:
Pula is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Pula needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, and crops. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. Pula will use the profits from her sales to finance her immediate family needs.

loans.use: to sell taro and bananas from her garden by purchasing fertilizer, chemicals, and crops.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. She is 49 years old. Lilibeth is married and has four children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns about 6,000 PHP per month for these activities. Recently, she joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to support her food business by purchasing raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en:
Alasa is a 42-year-old, married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Alasa has requested a loan to buy knives, rakes, chemicals, and fertilizer. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. With her profits, Alasa hopes to expand her current business.

loans.use: to grow taro and bananas for a living by purchasing knives, rakes, chemicals, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Togboy

texts.ru:
Тогбой очень добрый человек. Он живет в очень старом доме, который построил его отец.
Тогбой женат и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Тогбой единственный кормилец в семье. Дети учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но доход Тогбоя от его бизнеса не достаточно для этого. Тогбой несколько лет занимается купле продажей продовольственных товаров. Он имеет свой ларек на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Его доход от бизнеса хватает для обеспечения семьи продуктами питания и не дорогих одежд, а для ремонта нет. Он должен отремонтировать все комнаты, а также кухню и фасад дома. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома.  Тогбой обещает погасить займ во время. Тогбой  и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en:
Togboy is a very kind man.  He lives in a very old house, built by his own father. 

Togboy is married and raising six children.  Since his wife is a homemaker, he is the sole breadwinner in the family.  His children, who are high school students, always ask their parents to repair their house, but Togboy's salary is not sufficient to perform those repairs.

Togboy has been buying and selling food products for a few years.  He has his own booth at the local market and his own clientele.  The salary he derives from this business is enough to provide his family with food and inexpensive clothing, but not to repair his house.  He needs to repair every room, as well as the kitchen and the exterior front wall of his house.  To this end, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to purchase building materials. 

Togboy promises to repay his loan on time.  He and his children are counting on the help of kind lenders to help them solve their housing situation.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Marcos Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos tiene 23 años, soltero, ella  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión se dedica a la variedad de poleras, blusas y pantalones, el tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Cochabamba donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Marcos va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  de ropa  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de navidad  tienen mucha demanda, El Sr. Marcos va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, El Sr. Marcos es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Marcos is 23 years old and is single. He sells different types of clothes depending on the season. On this occasion he is selling t-shirts, blouses and trousers. He has a stall in one of the busiest markets in the city of Cochabamba. This is where he sells his products. 

This loan will be his first cycle with the institution. Marcos will use the loan to buy different types of clothes wholesale, and so offer a wider variety of clothes to his customers, in this way increasing his earnings. He is requesting this loan in order to continue improving his business. Also demand is very high at the moment because Christmas is approaching. Marcos will use the profits to buy more clothes of different types. Marcos is a very hardworking person and is very happy to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old and married, with five children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Marilou has been raising chickens for 15 years. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

Marilou is borrowing 13000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional chickens to raise and feed. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens to raise and feed.

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Ana sigue con la misma actividad de un café internet cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que compro computadoras para su negocio y en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de muebles para computadoras ya que quiere renovar los que tienen.
texts.en:
Ana continues with her same job, an internet cafe.  She says the previous loan went well for her because she bought computers for her business.

This time she's requesting the loan to buy computer furniture because she wants to renovate what she has.

loans.use: to buy computer furniture

loans.name: Dilbarkhon

texts.en:
Dilbarkhon is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a very hard-working and industrious woman. 

Seven months ago, Dilbarkhon began to work as a nurse at a hospital in order to provide her family with good living conditions. She likes her job very much and tries to be a perfect worker. 

She wants to buy all the necessary things for her children, but her salary is small. Her husband does not help her to realize her plans. She would like to buy furniture for her house, but she does not have enough money. 

Dilbarkhon is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS (somoni) to buy furniture. She awaits your support and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household.

loans.name: Niulea

texts.en: Niulea is 38 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling bakery foods in her community and has been doing this for many years. Niulea has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, custard, butter, cooking oil and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Niulea will use her next loan to expand her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, custard, baking soda,and oil.

loans.name: Maliana

texts.en: Maliana is a 29 year old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Maliana needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan and cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Maliana has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan,and oil.

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.ru: Зарофату 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Зарофат имеет конкретных целей и всегда старается, чтобы ее ребенок не нуждался не в чем. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами  5 лет назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женских национальных платьев. Она работает в ателье в центре города. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее доход не хватает для покупки всех необходимых средств, а ее муж не имеет постоянную работу. Он планирует уехать в Российскую Федерацию и найти подходящею работу. Заработанные деньги он будет отправлять семье, чтобы Зарофат могла купить все не обходимые средства для проживания. Зарофат запрашивает займ на сумму 1500  сомони для покупки авиабилета для мужа. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zarofat is 31 years old.  She is married and raising one child.  She is a very hardworking and kind woman.  She has set some concrete goals for herself and she always tries to do her best so that her child does not lack anything.  

In order to support her family, she started her own sewing business five years ago.  She sews women's traditional Tajik clothing and works in a shop in the center of town.  Thanks to the high quality of her service, she enjoys a large group of customers.  

However, Zarofat's salary is not sufficient to buy all the necessities of life, and her husband does not have a regular job.  He is planning to travel to the Russian Federation to find proper employment.  He will be sending his earnings to his family, so that Zarofat can buy the basic necessities of life.  

Zarofat is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy a plane ticket for her husband.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband.

loans.name: Medelina Kiden

texts.en: Kiden lives in Yei, She has benefited a lot from the previous loan. She has increased the stock in a store, built a small house and is now requesting a new loan to buy more items such as onions, okra and others. She is happy for the loan.

loans.use: to buy items like onions, okra, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, and soap for her general store business.

Mary has been in this business for 29 years. Mary earns more income from buying and selling rice and fattening pigs.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money for her children to attend college in the future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, soap, and more.

loans.name: Zoila Maribel

texts.es: La señora Zoila tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida con su esposo.  Ella siempre se ha dedicado a las labores del hogar y hace dos años aproximadamente en busca de obtener ingresos logro establecer su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, harina, sal, manteca, churros, refrescos, pastillas, jabón etc. doña Zoila quiere hacer crecer su negocio, con su buena administración y con la inversión de préstamos. Actualmente está solicitando uno de 21,000 Lempiras con el cual va surtir de más productos como carnes, refrescos, dulces, granos básicos, azúcar, churros, pastillas y productos de aseo. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y seguir manteniendo un buen record crediticio con la institución.
texts.en:
Zoila, 49, is married living in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida, with her husband.  She’s always done housework and two years ago approximately seeking to earn income she managed to open her own grocery store where she sells basic family staple items like rice, beans, corn, sugar, flour, salt, lard, packaged snacks, soft-drinks, pills, soap, etc.  

Zoila wants to make her business grow by means of her good management and by investing loans.  She’s currently requesting a 21,000 Lempira loan to stock up on meats, soft-drinks, candy, basic grains, sugar, packaged snacks, pills and cleaning supplies.  Her plan is to make the business grow and to continue keeping up her good credit record with the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Barrio Suyapa Group

texts.es:
La Joven Delma de 26  años de edad,  vive con su mama en su  casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, la actividad que realiza es la sastrería, elabora pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, trajes etc. su negocio esta ubicado en  el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por la calle donde ella tiene su negocio 
Delma solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como telas, accesorio, botones, hilos, broches, lentejuelas, alfileres etc.  Necesita  el préstamo para compra telas y así tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada donde se vende bastante.
Delma con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo.
Doña Hilda se dedica  de venta de verduras y granos básicos en mercado municipal.
Doña Aminta tiene un puesto de venta de verduras, ellas están contentas de trabajar con Prisma, el sueño de ellas es poder mejorar su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Delma, young, is 26 years old. She lives with her mother in her home located in a community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. 

Her activity is tailoring. She makes pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, suits, etc. Her business is located in the municipal market of San Lorenzo. Her clients are all the people passing through the street where she has her business. Delma is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as fabric, accessories, buttons, thread, snaps, sequins, pins, etc. She needs a loan to buy fabric in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers in this season when there are plenty of sales.

Delma with the support of this loan intends to continue investing in her business and to continue growing the same as the other members of her group. Hilda works selling vegetables and basic grains in the municipal market. Aminta has a stand selling vegetables. They are happy to work with Prisma. Their dream is to be able to improve their homes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy fabric, accessories, buttons, thread, snaps, sequins, pins, etc. for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El Sr. Samuel tiene 32 años y es soltero con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 1 años, el se dedica a la venta de bananas al por mayor en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Samuel  va a usar este préstamo para compra de bananas por carga el compra todo un camión y después vende al por mayor a los mismos comerciantes  de fruta del mercado,  el Sr. Samuel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el ser más competitivo en el mercado y  va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Samuel, 32, is single and has a one-year-old son.  He sells bananas at wholesale in his sales stand located in one of the city of Santa Cruz’s busiest markets.  This loan will be his first sequence in the institution and Samuel will use it to buy bananas by the load; he will buy an entire truckload and then sell them at wholesale to the very merchants in the market.  The business challenge Samuel faces is being more competitive in the marketplace and he will use profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas at wholesale.

loans.name: Jacqueline Ana

texts.es: La Sra. Jacqueline tiene 40 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 18 y 12 años,  ella se dedica a la  administración de su restaurante que se encuentran ubicado en la zona  23 de marzo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jacqueline va a usar este préstamo para compra de refrescos verduras y otros por mayor para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de capital. Jacqueline enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran competencia que hay en el sector, ella va a utilizar los beneficios aumentando el inventario en lo que es refrescos su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de venta de comida criolla.
texts.en: Jacqueline, 40, is single and has two children who are 18 and 12 years old.  She works managing her restaurant located in the 23 de Marzo zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Jacqueline will use it to buy soft-drinks, vegetables and others at wholesale for her business.  The reason for requesting the loan is to increase capital.  The business challenge Jacqueline faces is the great amount of competition in the sector.  She will use profits to increase soft-drink inventory.  Her wish for the business is to have a chain of creole food sales.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, vegetables and others at wholesale.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ms Ameena is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of one son and four daughters. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She is running a business manufacturing spare parts called ‘buffers’ which are a product used in machinery within factories for alignment purposes.  She has gained ten years of experience in this field. Ameena and her husband are jointly running this business. Her husband assists her in selling the parts to factories and the local market. They also help their customers by providing repair services. They have become well known for providing good quality buffers in their community.

It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy good quality leather, screws and some tools to increase her production. Ameena expects to boost her net income and wishes to spend part of profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality leather, screws and some tools to increase her production.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David  tiene 46 años tiene dos hijos de la edad de 19  y 17 años,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la zona de Percy Fernandez,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. David va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para terminar un cuarto de su casa  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,  el  Sr. David va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, el Sr. David es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: David, 46, has two children who are 19 and 17 years old.  He works in construction and home remodeling; he’s a building contractor.  He lives in the Percy Fernández zone and this loan is his first sequence in the institution.  David will use it to buy building materials and supplies to finish a room at home.  His reason for requesting the loan is to provide more comfort for his family.  David will use profits to buy work tools because the ones he has are worn down and he needs to renovate them to do better work.  David is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity provided by the granted loan because this is the only activity he has for his support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Carlos Esteban

texts.es: El Sr.  Carlos tiene 32 años tiene dos hijos que tienen las edades de 5 y 2 años,  El Sr. Carlos  se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es mecánico  hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la Zona de las Américas  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Carlos  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra material de construcción para la construcción de un tinglado en su casa ya que esta época de lluvia no le deja hacer su trabajo normalmente ya que espera que calme la lluvia  para seguir trabajando y esto le ayudara a  brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Carlos va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller.
texts.en: Carlos, 32, has two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  Carlos works repairing cars; he’s been an auto mechanic for several years now and his shop where he offers his services is located in the Américas zone.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Carlos will use it to buy building materials and supplies to build a shed at home because he can’t do his work normally in the rainy season because he has to wait until it stops raining to do his work.  He hopes this will help him provide better customer service and increase profits.  His reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving his activity.  Carlos will use profits to continue buying tools to continue equipping his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Patzanes 3 Group

texts.es:
DUO PATZANES 3
Este dúo lo forma María Elizabeth quien es  casada y tiene 4 hijos que aun viven con ella y 2 de ellos están estudiando todavía, además es dueña de dos vacas que le proveen leche, y luego ella lo vende todos los días en su sector por litro también hace crema, y queso que sale a surtir en las tiendas desde hace mucho tiempo, tambien tiene cerdos y por eso que solicita este préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animales (vacas y cerdos)y asi invertir en sus animales porque necesitan concentrado y vitaminas para que siguen dando suficiente leche.
texts.en:
PATZANES 3 DUO

María Elizabeth is part of this Duo.  She’s married and has four children still living with her; two of them are still attending school.  She owns two dairy cows that produce milk she sells by the liter in her neighborhood every day; she also makes cream and cheese that she’s been selling to stores for a long time.  She also has pigs and this is why she’s requesting the loan to buy feed for her animals (cows and pigs) to invest in her animals because they need feed concentrate and vitamins so they will continue producing sufficient milk.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Sra.  Justina  tiene 49 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 21  y 25 años, los dos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad,   La Sra. Justina se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como Carnes, verduras y abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Justina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de carne y variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Justina  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Justina is 49 years old. She has two children, ages 21 and 25, and both of them are studying in university.

Justina sells a variety of staples such as meat, vegetables and groceries, sweets, soft drinks and a variety of articles in her neighborhood store. This loan is her first sequence with the institution.

Justina is going to use this loan to buy meat and a variety of groceries to supply her business such as rice, noodles, flour and sugar and in this way she will provide a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business.

Justina is going to use the profits to continue buying products thus improving her income. Her goal for the business is to have a stock-room and so provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat and other products for her store

loans.name: Tito Claudio

texts.es: El Sr. Tito  tiene 18 años soltero, tiene el oficio de carpintero se dedica la fabricación de muebles y en algunos casos arreglos de muebles, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Tito   va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mas madera y herramientas para su carpintería,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de capital,  Tito enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tito is 18 years old, single, and is a carpenter. He makes furniture and sometimes repairs furniture. 

This is his first loan sequence with the institution. Tito is going to use this loan to buy more wood and tools for his carpentry. His reason for asking for this loan is to increase his capital. 

Tito faces challenges in his business by leaving poverty but he will use his profits to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for his carpentry business

loans.name: In-2012-988 Group

texts.es:
PATZANES DE SACATEPEQUEZ
Este dúo está formado por doña Maritza Hidalia, tiene 2 hijos es casada, y vende ropa de niño, y accesorios para la cocina como manteles, individuales, camino de mesa, y ropa para dama también, y está solicitando este crédito porque necesita invertir ahora que es temporada de ventas hay muchas personas que le han encargado mucha mercadería y sus ingresos van a incrementar si tiene suficiente mercadería las ventas van a subir nesecita comprar mas mercaderia y asi ir agrandando mas su negocio.
texts.en:
PATZANES DE SACATEPEQUEZ

Maritza Hidalia is part of this Duo.  She’s married and has two children.  She sells children’s clothes and kitchen accessories like tablecloths, place mats, table runners and also women’s clothes.  She’s asking for this loan because she needs to invest now for this season of sales; there are many people who have placed merchandise orders and her income will increase if she has enough merchandise.  Her sales are going to go up and she needs to buy more merchandise to gradually increase her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Pintadillera Group

texts.es:
La señora Sara tiene 33 años de edad, vive con  esposo, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de pulpería en donde vende granos básicos, lácteos, jugos, jabón, carnes, embutidos, etc. su venta la realiza con los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad que ha diario le visitan para comprar lo que necesitan en sus hogares.
Doña Sara es una persona humilde y trabajadora que su deseo es salir adelante con su negocio. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de churros, pollo, carnes, detergentes, frescos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan, aguas, papel higiénico, pastas, salsas  etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar  su negocio y tener mejores ganancias ya que tendrá mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, esta contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, al igual que sus demás compañeras que la han nombrado la líder del grupo.
Doña Isis, tiene un negocio de una mini pulpería.
Doña Lorenza tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Sara, 33, lives with her husband; she has two children who depend on her.  She lives in her own house and has been a grocer for ten years; she sells basic grains, dairy products, juices, meats, canned goods, etc.  She sells to friends and neighbors in her community who visit her daily to buy what they need for their homes.

Sara is a humble, hardworking woman who wants to get ahead with her business.  She’s requesting a loan to buy packaged snacks, chicken, meats, detergent, rice, sugar, beans, bread, water, toilet paper, pasta, sauces, etc.  With support from the loan she hopes to improve the business and have higher profits because she’ll have more products to offer her customers.  She’s happy to continue working with Prisma as well as with her fellow members who have made her group leader.

Isis has a mini-grocery store and Lorenza sells tortillas and her dream is to improve her house and her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2012.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Sra. Justina  tiene 35 años con dos hijos de 12 y 17 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales dietéticos de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial  su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona de Barrio internacional,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Justina  utilizara el dinero del préstamo   para ampliar la gama de productos naturales dietéticos que vende, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Justina enfrenta retos en su negocio como mejorar su negocio en cuanto a variedad, ya que existe mucha competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de productos de nutrición, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable donde ofrezca variedad de productos naturales que ofrecer a su clientela, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Justina, 35, has two children who are 12 and 17 years old.  She sells natural dietary products of a world-renown firm.  Her sales stand is located in the Barrio Internacional zone.  This loan is her fourth sequence in the institution and Justina will use the money from the loan to expand the range of natural, dietary products she sells.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have enough money to expand the variety of products she sells.  The business challenge Justina faces is how to improve the business with respect to variety because there is much competition and she wants her business to be stable and profitable and to offer a wide variety of natural products to her customers in order to improve income and thus her and her entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy health products.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos. Este es el grupo “Uniendo Fuerzas” conformados por 08 socios entusiastas y trabajadores. Siendo Margarita la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Hace varios años  que trabaja en un colegio, brindando  servicio de docente. Actualmente está iniciando un negocio, la cual consiste en el alquiler de disfraces para niños. Es por ello que solicito el crédito para la compra de disfraces. Con sus créditos anteriores a podido mejorar su vivienda.  Su mayor deseo es de es crecer en su nuevo negocio. Margarita es casada y tiene 01 hijo la cual ha sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. La Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” agradece el crédito brindado, ya que hacen posible su progreso. Margarita se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca color rojo.
texts.en:
Warmest greetings. 

This is the group “Uniendo Fuerzas” which is made up of eight enthusiastic members and workers.

Margarita is the treasurer of the group, a position she has taken responsibly. She has been working in a school for some years, serving as a  teacher. Currently she is starting a business which consists of renting costumes for children. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy costumes. With her previous loans she could improve her housing.

Her greatest desire is to grow her new business. Margarita is married and has one son which has been her motive to get ahead. She feels happy because thanks to her work she can continue supporting her family.

The communal bank “Uniendo Fuerzas” is grateful for the loans provided as they make it possible to progress. 

Margarita is in the back row, over on the right side, and is wearing a red jacket.

loans.use: to buy costumes for her business of renting costumes for children

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is 37 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling sandwiches, donuts, etc. to her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Fale has requested a loan to purchase more goods for her canteen. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fale will save more to help her family in the future and also pay for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy flour, bread, butter, and sugar for her canteen

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Ruby de 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ranchos víveres, y ropa en general, negocio que inició desde hacen 32 años, porque desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio, ya que sus padres fueron muy emprendedores y con ellos aprendió a trabajar. Inicialmente tenía una tienda de barrio, la que le consumía mucho tiempo y por eso cambió a otra actividad como la distribución de víveres, con el fin de pasar un mayor tiempo con sus hijos. Su negocio maneja el crédito y el contado simultáneamente, depende de si los clientes son fieles o apenas inician las negociaciones con Ruby, quien realiza sus compras en el departamento de la Guajira, de contado, trabajando de lunes a sábados, desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 7 de la noche, distribuyendo entre las tiendas del sector. Ruby ha aplicado a 21 préstamos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y desde que está vinculada a esta organización ha logrado su crecimiento empresarial y darle estudios a sus hijos, para que sigan ampliando sus posibilidades futuras de sostenimiento. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y que sus hijos algún día tengan su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará arroz, aceite, leche, y ropa, esta última inversión es sobre pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, a propósito de las fiestas de fin de año que se acercan y en las cuales espera hacer su mejor venta del año.
texts.en:
Ruby is 55 years old and sells food and clothing, a business she began 32 years ago because she decided to go into business when she was young.  Her parents were very enterprising and she learned to work from them.  She used to have a neighborhood store, but it took too much time, so she changed to delivering food so that she could spend time with her children.  She accepts cash and credit, depending on the customers and whether they are new or longstanding.  Ruby makes her purchases in cash in the Guajira department and works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, delivering to the stores in the area.

Ruby has had 21 loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her business has grown since she affiliated with this organization; and she has been able to provide an education for her children, so that she can continue to expand their own future possibilities.

Her goal is to continue expanding her business and for her children have their own homes someday.  She will use the money from this Kiva loan to buy rice, cooking oil, milk, and clothing.  This latest item is to fill requests from customers for the upcoming end of year festivities, where she expects to make her best sales for the year.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Dúo Verdad Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Dúo Verdad y Vida
Dora  Leticia de 25 años  de edad casada y madre de  dos niñas de 9 y 7 y un varón de 5 años de edad, doña Dora líder de este dúo desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a la  elaboración y venta de tortillas actualmente  ha incluido la venta de leña aprovechando la visita de las personas que vistan su  domicilio para la compra de tortillas el cual ella elabora en  dos tiempos de comida. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña para la venta.
texts.en:
“Verdad y Vida” Duo

Dora Leticia is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two girls, ages 9 and 7, and a five year old boy.  Dora has been the leader of this duo for two years and makes and sells tortillas.  She recently added firewood sales to leverage the need of those to visit her to buy tortillas, which she makes.  She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn and firewood to sell.
.

loans.use: to buy dried corn and firewood.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano  es un hombre agricultor de 37  años de edad.  El está en unión simple junto a su esposa  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene tres hijos  varones  ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en tiempos libres.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla y papa  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su casa, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde que era pequeño porque el lo apoyaba en el campo de la agricultura y eso fue su primer trabajo.
El cuenta con quince  años de realizar su propio cultivo y ser independiente viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q  4,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo en otras parcelas y darles estudios académicos a sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a farmer of 37 years of age. He has a simple relationship with his wife and he lives in Sololá. He has three sons studying in a community school and they help him in the field in their free time.

He works growing onions and potatoes on plots that he has a few meters from his house. He learned from his father when he was little because he helped out in the fields and it was his first job.

He has spent 15 years farming on his own and being independent and seeing that he is getting good earnings, he is growing these vegetables. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 quetzales so he can buy potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivating and harvesting to improve the family income.

His dream is to expand his cultivation to other farmlands and to provide his children an education to improve the conditions of life for all his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
For over five years in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Wilfreda, a 40-year-old single mother of one child, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Wilfreda joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps for her store

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a 43-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Nelia has been involved in her business of raising pigs and hogs for 3 years and she gets an income of 6,500 PHP per month. Nelia became a member of GDMPC this year. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku describes herself as a hardworking woman with the desire to move forward. She is a married mother of seven children, none of whom are in school. She has been operating a vegetable stall for the last seven years, selling the vegetables from her home. Maku says that she faces the challenge of seasonality and theft of her products. Despite these adversities, she has been able to remain in business, which has helped her cater for the household expenses.

Maku wants to increase her merchandise but she says that she does not have enough working capital, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her stall. This way she is sure to satisfy her customers and at the same time provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her food stall

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by growing garlic in the local area. Having been in this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 6,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Lak has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Lak will use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. Lak hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily consumption so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 62 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia Carolina de 31 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de joyeria y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion de costuras a maquina, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y gracias a Dios le a hido bien en su negocio, está solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia y surtir más su negocio.
texts.en: Claudia Carolina is 31 and sells jewelry and sews.  She has been doing this for several years and thanks to God things have gone well for her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alex Adan

texts.es:
El  Señor Alex tiene 37 años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20  años a la venta de  refrescos, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, carme, pollo, embutidos, pastas, salsas, su negocio está  ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan. 
Don Alex está solicitando 25,000.00 lempiras para compra de carne, huevos, refrescos, mantaca, frijoles, salsa, leche, queso, jabón, embutidos, agua, pastas, salsas, churros y pan.
Don Alex su sueño es compararse un carro donde pueda transportarse.   

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Alex is 37 years old and lives in a home of his own, located in the San Lorenzo community of Honduras.  He has been selling soft drinks, rice, beans, lard, eggs, meat, chicken, sausages, pasta, salsas, churros, and bread for the past 20 years.  His business is in his home and his customers are friends and neighbors.

Alex is asking for 25,000 Lempiras to buy meat, eggs, soft drinks, lard, beans salsa, milk, cheese, soap, sausages, water, pasta, salsa, churros, and bread.  His dream is to buy himself a car.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years, and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Robelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (pictured here), 42, is a tailor. His wife, Savy, 42, is a garment worker. They live in in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, one attends school and the other one assists his father in a fishing business.

In addition, Savy also grows rice when rice-farming season comes. And when fishing season allows, he fishes with help from his son.  

Savy is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a water pumping machine to spray his rice farm because the old one is broken.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy, 39, is an entrepreneur  from Zamboanga del Sur. She is married to Ramon Magsaysay, and has 1 child. She started her retail business almost 2 years ago and now earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit – which she just joined recently – to buy items such as milks, diapers, food products, etc.  Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as milks, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Loem Ang

texts.en:
Loem Ang (in the photo) is single. She lives with her parents and brother and sister in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Loem Ang works in a village office. She is also in farming business when she is free. She grows jujube. 

Loem Ang is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to maintain her jujube farm by buying pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.use: To maintain her jujube farm by buying pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Union Femenil Del Comercio Group

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia es viuda, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 5 estan estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes y guipiles típicos del lugar donde vive y de otros lugares, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara, para la compra de materiales, tales como hilos y labores de diferentes colores y diseños, espera seguir mejorando, ya que quiere tener mayor capital y mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 45-year-old woman, widow and mother of 5 children, all of whom are studying. She did not have the opportunity to study and makes a living weaving textiles and guipiles [traditional blouses] from where she lives and from other areas. She started this business thanks to the support of her husband and, as of today, she has 8 years of experience. 

She has put together a group to request a loan that she will use to buy materials, such as threads and textiles in different colors and designs. She expects to continue improving as she wants to attain greater capital and income. The other members in the group make artisan crafts.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving textiles and guipiles [traditional blouses].

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: As a married parent of 4 children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a computer service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice grinding.  She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business. Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. Thanks to the previous loan that helped her stock up her business, she says that she was able to include the sale of charcoal in her firewood selling business. Mariam dreams of having several businesses in the future so that she can continue providing her family with a good quality of life. With this new investment, she will be able to buy more bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Leangsim's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sa Ang district, Leangsim is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are still in school.  She has been planting and selling garlic in the local area to support her family for 10 years. She is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day, and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Leangsim is leading her group of four to request her first microloan from Kiva partner VisionFund.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile draining, sewage, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than was born in 1953. She has four children who work as laborers and farmers; one is a student. Her husband sells tobacco to earn a living. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. Than is a farmer who raises pigs, and earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Than has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre agricultor de 31  años de edad, el está en unión simple junto a su esposa  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene tres hijos de ellos uno es  varón  y  dos mujeres.
 Ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa y repollo  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde niño cuando el estudiaba en la escuela primaria y ayudaba en el campo de la agricultura y eso fue su primer trabajo.
El ahora cuenta con cinco años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 10,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa, plantillas de repollo y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo mejorando sus ganancias y  terminar de construir una vivienda que tiene para  su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 31-year-old farmer in a common-law marriage with his wife and he lives in Sololá.  He has three children: one boy and two girls.  They study in a school in the community and support him in the field in their free time.

He makes a living in agriculture cultivating onions, potatoes and cabbage in plots that he has a few meters from his home.  This he learned from his father when he was a child studying in primary school and helping in the field of agriculture and that was his first job.

He has now spent five years doing his own farming seeing that he obtains good profits cultivating these vegetables.  He is requesting a loan of 10,000 quetzales (GTQ) so that he can buy potato seeds, cabbage seedlings and fertilizer to cultivate and harvest them, improving the family's income.

He dreams of expanding his crops, improving his profits, finishing the construction of a house that he has for his family and giving them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and cabbage seedlings to cultivate.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: Doña  Martha tiene 55 años de edad, es miembro del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es una familia muy trabajadora y unida, su esposo es agricultor y también se dedica a la ganadería. Doña Martha inicio su negocio desde hace cinco años tiene instalada una pulpería en su hogar y también horna y vende pan, su horario de atención inicia desde las 6:00 am y culmina a las 9:00 pm. Su ventaja es que la pulpería tiene muy buena ubicación. El préstamo que doña Martha esta solicitando lo necesita para surtir su negocio y lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, manteca, frijoles, jabón, detergente, productos lácteos, refrescos, churros, dulces, harina, embutidos, etc. Ella espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ingresos aumenten y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar su pulpería y que sea una de las más surtidas de la zona. Doña Martha tiene 4 años de solicitar préstamos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus compromisos de pago de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old. She is a member of Banco Comunal Nueva Luz, is married and has five children. It is a very hardworking and close-knit family. Her husband is a farmer and also works at cattle raising. Martha began her business five years ago. She has set up a store in her home, as well as an oven, and sells bread. Her work schedule begins at 6:00 am and ends at 9:00 pm. To her advantage, the store is in a very good location.

Martha needs the loan she is requesting to stock her business and invest in the purchase of products like rice, lard, beans, soap, detergent, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, sweets, flour, sausages, etc. She hopes that with the help of this loan, her income will grow and therefore enable her to assist her husband with home expenses. Her dream is to improve her store and have one of the most stocked stores in the area. Martha has requested loans from FAMA for four years and has fulfilled her payment commitments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy general grocery items.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, who was born in 1957, has three children who are drivers and chicken egg sellers. Her husband is a farmer with a monthly income of 2,000,000 VND. Hoa has been raising pigs and chickens to earn a living for 18 years, making about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Hoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007, having last borrowed and repaid 9,632,000 VND. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,080,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens and pigs. Working hard to earn more money for her family, she hopes to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is from Taguitic, Kapatagan. She is 38 years old. Lilian is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling crabs. She has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from this activity. 

Lilian joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy additional crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Maelyn

texts.en:
Maelyn, 32, is married and resides at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Maelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 doing this business. 

This year, Maelyn joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase new items to diversify her product offerings. Maelyn aims for future business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase new items, to diversify the product offerings of her store.

loans.name: Sahobiddin

texts.ru: Сахобиддин родился в 1955 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена Гульсара домохозяйка и она занимается воспитанием детей. Дети Танзима, Салохидин, Джамшед, Бибихалима учатся в школе и университете. Сахобиддин занимается скотоводством более 12 лет, но его доход не позволяет ему оплатить за учебы сына в университете, так как Джамшед  учится в университете. Он очень способный парень. В свободное время читает книги и занимается спортом.  Сахобиддин запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете.  Сахобиддин и Джамшед ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sahobiddin was born in 1955.  He is married and is raising 4 children.  His wife, Gulsara, is a homemaker and raises the children.  The children: Tanzima, Salohidin, Djamshed, and Bibihalima study at school and university.  Sahobiddin has been raising livestock for over 12 years, but his income does not allow him to pay for his son's university studies as Djamshed attends university.  He is a very capable young man.  In his free time he reads books and participates in sports.  Sahobiddin is asking for a loan to pay for his son's university studies.  Sahobiddin and Djamshed are waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходуру 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена Насиба очень умная и добрая женщина. Баходур счастлив, что имеет такую хорошую жену. Дети еще не в состоянии помогать родителям для содержания семьи. Итак, Баходур основной кормилец в семье. Он старается из-за всех сил обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Он более 6 лет работает электриком. Он предоставляет услугу электрика местным жителям и получает доход от этого. Он в состоянии купить продукты питания и другие средства для проживания. Однако у него нет сбережения, чтобы начать ремонт и улучшить условия дома. Его дом уже старый и должен отремонтировать все комнаты, начиная с зала до детской и кухни. У него дома нет условия для проведения зимы и ему необходим займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он обещает погасить займ во время. Баходур и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Bahodur is 42 years old.  He is married and is raising 4 children.  His wife, Nasiba, is a very smart and kind woman.  Bahodur is happy that he has such a good wife.  The children are not yet able to help the parents support the family.  Therefore, Bahodur is the main provider in the family.  He tries with all his might to provide the family with all the necessary resources.  He has been working as an electrician for more then 6 years.  He provides electrical services to local residents and earns an income this way.  His house is already old and he needs to repair all the rooms, starting with the entryway and continuing on to the children's room and kitchen.  His house is not winterized and he needs a loan of 2000 somoni for the purchase of building materials.  He promises to pay back the loan on time.  Bahodur and his children will wait until kind creditors help them to solve their housing problems.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair house

loans.name: Sinalaupepa

texts.en: Sinaluapepa is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Sinaluapepa needs a loan to develop her business. She plans to use her profits to help her small family with financial issues. Sinaluapepa joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of foam cups, cordials, sugar, mixture, to use in making her ices to sell.

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en: Sisilia is 43 years old and married, and she has four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas, which she can sell in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sisilia needs a loan to buy tools and farm inputs, like knives, weed spray, a spade, and a wheelbarrow, to use in growing and harvesting her crops. Sisilia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy tools and farm inputs, like knives, weed spray, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years. She also earns income from raising livestock and selling poultry supplies.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock to resell in her store, like canned goods, shampoo, coffee and soap. Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to resell in her store, including canned goods, shampoo, coffee and soap.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc was born in 1979. She has four children who are learning at secondary school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a barber and gets 2,500,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Cuc also is a barber for women to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy scissors and barber tools for her barber shop. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income to enable her children to have good careers.

loans.use: to buy scissors and barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is a married woman with six grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a bakery for five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which will help her to meet their daily needs.

Morena is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar and baking soda. These ingredients will be used in making bread, and she will sell it in her local community. 

In the future, Morena dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar and baking soda for making bread.

loans.name: Dúo Flor De Maiz Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DE MAIZ
Doña Maria Ramona es originaria de Tecpan ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones y a la crianza de pollos. Desde hace varios años ella viene realizando esta actividad ya que es el medio que ha tenido para salir adelante. 
Doña Ramona vende sus refacciones en en el mercado municipal de tecpan ya que ella ya es bien conocida por sus clientes  por su negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue realizando su actividad ya que su esposo lo apoya moral y económicamente.
Ella sueña ampliar mas su negocio  para ofrecer variedad de productos para  obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida, ya tuvo un crédito Kiva y sus pagos los hizo a la fecha no cayo en mora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
DUO FLOR DE MAIZ

Maria Ramona is from Tecpan. She sells snacks and raises chickens. She has done this activity for several years and it is how she has gotten ahead.  
 
Ramona sells her snacks in the city market of Tecpan and she is well known by her customers from her business. Thanks to her husband's support she continues with this activity, since he is her moral and financial support.

She dreams of expanding her business more to offer a variety of  products and to improve her quality of life. She already had a Kiva loan and she made her payments on time without falling behind. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise to make her snacks.

loans.use: to buy edible merchandise for making snacks

loans.name: Vaipapa

texts.en: Vaipapa is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She makes and sells ice cream cones in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Vaipapa needs a loan to buy ice creams and cones. She plans to use her profits to help support her family and develop her business. Vaipapa joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy ice cream flavors, cones, and a freezer.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 42-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 13. All of them go to school. 

Alfred runs a clothing store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan Limited through promotions by the loan officers. 

He is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase more clothes and other items. In addition to this business, Alfred has no other source of income.

In five years, Alfred would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Alfred says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan Limited, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and other items for his clothing store.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel le fue muy bien con su anterior credikiva, pues compró mucho pescado y lo vendió, generando una vez mas utilidades nuevas en su negocio; con su nuevo credikiva, al que hoy aplica, comprará al por mayor y de contado pescado, como sable corvina, carito, cojinúa, sierra, robalo, pargo, jurel y langostinos, con esta inversión responderá a su acreditada clientela de Puerto Colombia, en una temporada muy rentable comercialmente y esto es justamente donde radica el éxito de su credikiva. Angel envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Que la santísima virgen los colme de bendiciones a ustedes y sus familias por la generosidad mostrada con los pequeños empresarios del mundo. “
texts.en:
Angel did very well with his last Kiva loan.  He bought and sold a lot of fish, once again generating profits for his business.  With his new Kiva loan, which he is now applying for, he will buy fish at wholesale on a cash basis.  He will buy fish such as: largehead hairtail, corvina, painted mackerel, blue runner,  Spanish mackerel, sea bass, snapper, Crevalle Jack, and prawns.  With this investment, he will be able to respond to the demands coming from his established customer base in Puerto Colombia.   This is a season that is commercially very profitable, and this will be precisely the reason for his success with this Kiva loan.  

Angel wants to send the following message to the Kiva lenders: "May the Blessed Virgin shower you and your families with blessings for the generosity you have shown towards the small-businessmen and women of the world."

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale

loans.name: Gerley

texts.en:
Gerley is from San Jose, Aurora in the Philippines. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. 

To make a living, Gerley owns and operates a general store. Gerley has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP per month for these activities. In 2011, Gerley joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Gerley is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items for her general store, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Tomngai Group

texts.en:
This is Tomngai group, which consists of eight members. These hard working Tribal women live in a small village on the outskirts of Senapati district in Manipur State located in the Northeastern part of India. This part of the state still lacks developmental programs, which is why these women came together as a group in 2008 to help one another to take a loan.

Nengneilam is the group leader. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and a mother to four sons and a daughter. All her children go to a private school nearby. Her husband's main source of income comes from cutting wood, which is a time-consuming process to turn into money.
